title.narrative: Empowering rural communities in Tanzania through media

description.narrative: The project draws together elements from Vikes previous community media project in Mtwara and Lindi regions and the further development of the community radio portal planned and created as part of Vikes internet journalism training project in Tanzania.The overall objective of the project is to contribute to a more open inclusive and democratic Tanzanian society by improving the efficiency of community media.As a result from the project interventions rural communities are expected to get their voices better heard through local community radio stations and a national online platform that will be created for news podcasts and live streaming of community media programmes from all over Tanzania.Improved flow of information is expected from rural areas in Tanzania to a wider national audience. Civil society organizations and government and local government entities can make use of the new community radio platform to effectively share information with rural communities. Citizens access to information is expected to increase improving transparency and good governance.The project has two immediate objectives:Improved sustainability of community radio operations in Mtwara and Lindi regions.Improved coverage of community radio programmes via new online platform.Project a ctivities include fundraising and equipment support to sustain the radio operations of Jamii FM community radio station in Mtwara in southern Tanzania. The hugely popular radio channel based in Naliendele village reaches a population of almost one million people living mostly in rural communities but the radio station suffers from constant power cuts and limited resources for fundraising to cover its operational costs.The new community radio platform will be planned and created making use of the existing tr ial portal from 2015. The new platform will allow community radio stations to air their programmes online and reach a national or even global audience also increasing their potential to generate income.Cooperation partners are Mtukwao Community Media and T anzania Development Information Organization (TADIO) the umbrella organization of Tanzanian community radio stations.
